<span id="L930" rel="#L930">930</span>
<span id="L931" rel="#L931">931</span>
<span id="L932" rel="#L932">932</span>
<span id="L933" rel="#L933">933</span>
<span id="L934" rel="#L934">934</span>
<span id="L935" rel="#L935">935</span>
<span id="L936" rel="#L936">936</span>
<span id="L937" rel="#L937">937</span>
<span id="L938" rel="#L938">938</span>
<span id="L939" rel="#L939">939</span>
<span id="L940" rel="#L940">940</span>
<span id="L941" rel="#L941">941</span>
<span id="L942" rel="#L942">942</span>
<span id="L943" rel="#L943">943</span>
<span id="L944" rel="#L944">944</span>
<span id="L945" rel="#L945">945</span>
<span id="L946" rel="#L946">946</span>
<span id="L947" rel="#L947">947</span>
<span id="L948" rel="#L948">948</span>
<span id="L949" rel="#L949">949</span>
<span id="L950" rel="#L950">950</span>
<span id="L951" rel="#L951">951</span>
<span id="L952" rel="#L952">952</span>
<span id="L953" rel="#L953">953</span>
<span id="L954" rel="#L954">954</span>
<span id="L955" rel="#L955">955</span>
<span id="L956" rel="#L956">956</span>
<span id="L957" rel="#L957">957</span>
<span id="L958" rel="#L958">958</span>
<span id="L959" rel="#L959">959</span>
<span id="L960" rel="#L960">960</span>

<span id="L1037" rel="#L1037">1037</span>
<span id="L1038" rel="#L1038">1038</span>

            </td>
            <td class="blob-line-code">
                    <div class="highlight"><pre><div class='line' id='LC1'>You may at your option receive a license to this program under EITHER</div><div class='line' id='LC2'>the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License (LGPL) OR the</div><div class='line' id='LC3'>Common Development and Distribution License (CDDL), see below.</div><div class='line' id='LC4'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC5'>---------------------------------------------------------------------</div><div class='line' id='LC6'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC7'>This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify</div><div class='line' id='LC8'>it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as</div><div class='line' id='LC9'>published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 2 of</div><div class='line' id='LC10'>the License, or (at your option) any later version.</div><div class='line' id='LC11'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC12'>See the GNU Lesser General Public License for more details:</div><div class='line' id='LC13'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl-2.1.html</div><div class='line' id='LC14'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC15'>---------------------------------------------------------------------</div><div class='line' id='LC16'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC17'>This program is subject to the terms of the Common Development and</div><div class='line' id='LC18'>Distribution License, version 1 of the License, or (at your option)</div><div class='line' id='LC19'>any later version.</div><div class='line' id='LC20'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC21'>See the Common Development and Distribution License for more details:</div><div class='line' id='LC22'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;http://opensource.org/licenses/CDDL-1.0</div><div class='line' id='LC23'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC24'>---------------------------------------------------------------------</div><div class='line' id='LC25'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC26'>This program contains code that is copyright the Apache Software</div><div class='line' id='LC27'>Foundation, licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0; you may</div><div class='line' id='LC28'>not use these files except in compliance with the License. You may</div><div class='line' id='LC29'>obtain a copy of the License at:</div><div class='line' id='LC30'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0</div><div class='line' id='LC31'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC32'>---------------------------------------------------------------------</div><div class='line' id='LC33'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC34'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;GNU LESSER GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE</div><div class='line' id='LC35'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Version 2.1, February 1999</div><div class='line' id='LC36'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC37'>&nbsp;Copyright (C) 1991, 1999 Free Software Foundation, Inc.</div><div class='line' id='LC38'>&nbsp;51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA  02110-1301  USA</div><div class='line' id='LC39'>&nbsp;Everyone is permitted to copy and distribute verbatim copies</div><div class='line' id='LC40'>&nbsp;of this license document, but changing it is not allowed.</div><div class='line' id='LC41'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC42'>[This is the first released version of the Lesser GPL.  It also counts</div><div class='line' id='LC43'>&nbsp;as the successor of the GNU Library Public License, version 2, hence</div><div class='line' id='LC44'>&nbsp;the version number 2.1.]</div><div class='line' id='LC45'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC46'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Preamble</div><div class='line' id='LC47'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC48'>&nbsp;&nbsp;The licenses for most software are designed to take away your</div><div class='line' id='LC49'>freedom to share and change it.  By contrast, the GNU General Public</div><div class='line' id='LC50'>Licenses are intended to guarantee your freedom to share and change</div><div class='line' id='LC51'>free software--to make sure the software is free for all its users.</div><div class='line' id='LC52'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC53'>&nbsp;&nbsp;This license, the Lesser General Public License, applies to some</div><div class='line' id='LC54'>specially designated software packages--typically libraries--of the</div><div class='line' id='LC55'>Free Software Foundation and other authors who decide to use it.  You</div><div class='line' id='LC56'>can use it too, but we suggest you first think carefully about whether</div><div class='line' id='LC57'>this license or the ordinary General Public License is the better</div><div class='line' id='LC58'>strategy to use in any particular case, based on the explanations below.</div><div class='line' id='LC59'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC60'>&nbsp;&nbsp;When we speak of free software, we are referring to freedom of use,</div><div class='line' id='LC61'>not price.  Our General Public Licenses are designed to make sure that</div><div class='line' id='LC62'>you have the freedom to distribute copies of free software (and charge</div><div class='line' id='LC63'>for this service if you wish); that you receive source code or can get</div><div class='line' id='LC64'>it if you want it; that you can change the software and use pieces of</div><div class='line' id='LC65'>it in new free programs; and that you are informed that you can do</div><div class='line' id='LC66'>these things.</div><div class='line' id='LC67'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC68'>&nbsp;&nbsp;To protect your rights, we need to make restrictions that forbid</div><div class='line' id='LC69'>distributors to deny you these rights or to ask you to surrender these</div><div class='line' id='LC70'>rights.  These restrictions translate to certain responsibilities for</div><div class='line' id='LC71'>you if you distribute copies of the library or if you modify it.</div><div class='line' id='LC72'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC73'>&nbsp;&nbsp;For example, if you distribute copies of the library, whether gratis</div><div class='line' id='LC74'>or for a fee, you must give the recipients all the rights that we gave</div><div class='line' id='LC75'>you.  You must make sure that they, too, receive or can get the source</div><div class='line' id='LC76'>code.  If you link other code with the library, you must provide</div><div class='line' id='LC77'>complete object files to the recipients, so that they can relink them</div><div class='line' id='LC78'>with the library after making changes to the library and recompiling</div><div class='line' id='LC79'>it.  And you must show them these terms so they know their rights.</div><div class='line' id='LC80'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC81'>&nbsp;&nbsp;We protect your rights with a two-step method: (1) we copyright the</div><div class='line' id='LC82'>library, and (2) we offer you this license, which gives you legal</div><div class='line' id='LC83'>permission to copy, distribute and/or modify the library.</div><div class='line' id='LC84'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC85'>&nbsp;&nbsp;To protect each distributor, we want to make it very clear that</div><div class='line' id='LC86'>there is no warranty for the free library.  Also, if the library is</div><div class='line' id='LC87'>modified by someone else and passed on, the recipients should know</div><div class='line' id='LC88'>that what they have is not the original version, so that the original</div><div class='line' id='LC89'>author&#39;s reputation will not be affected by problems that might be</div><div class='line' id='LC90'>introduced by others.</div><div class='line' id='LC91'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC92'>&nbsp;&nbsp;Finally, software patents pose a constant threat to the existence of</div><div class='line' id='LC93'>any free program.  We wish to make sure that a company cannot</div><div class='line' id='LC94'>effectively restrict the users of a free program by obtaining a</div><div class='line' id='LC95'>restrictive license from a patent holder.  Therefore, we insist that</div><div class='line' id='LC96'>any patent license obtained for a version of the library must be</div><div class='line' id='LC97'>consistent with the full freedom of use specified in this license.</div><div class='line' id='LC98'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC99'>&nbsp;&nbsp;Most GNU software, including some libraries, is covered by the</div><div class='line' id='LC100'>ordinary GNU General Public License.  This license, the GNU Lesser</div><div class='line' id='LC101'>General Public License, applies to certain designated libraries, and</div><div class='line' id='LC102'>is quite different from the ordinary General Public License.  We use</div><div class='line' id='LC103'>this license for certain libraries in order to permit linking those</div><div class='line' id='LC104'>libraries into non-free programs.</div><div class='line' id='LC105'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC106'>&nbsp;&nbsp;When a program is linked with a library, whether statically or using</div><div class='line' id='LC107'>a shared library, the combination of the two is legally speaking a</div><div class='line' id='LC108'>combined work, a derivative of the original library.  The ordinary</div><div class='line' id='LC109'>General Public License therefore permits such linking only if the</div><div class='line' id='LC110'>entire combination fits its criteria of freedom.  The Lesser General</div><div class='line' id='LC111'>Public License permits more lax criteria for linking other code with</div><div class='line' id='LC112'>the library.</div><div class='line' id='LC113'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC114'>&nbsp;&nbsp;We call this license the &quot;Lesser&quot; General Public License because it</div><div class='line' id='LC115'>does Less to protect the user&#39;s freedom than the ordinary General</div><div class='line' id='LC116'>Public License.  It also provides other free software developers Less</div><div class='line' id='LC117'>of an advantage over competing non-free programs.  These disadvantages</div><div class='line' id='LC118'>are the reason we use the ordinary General Public License for many</div><div class='line' id='LC119'>libraries.  However, the Lesser license provides advantages in certain</div><div class='line' id='LC120'>special circumstances.</div><div class='line' id='LC121'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC122'>&nbsp;&nbsp;For example, on rare occasions, there may be a special need to</div><div class='line' id='LC123'>encourage the widest possible use of a certain library, so that it becomes</div><div class='line' id='LC124'>a de-facto standard.  To achieve this, non-free programs must be</div><div class='line' id='LC125'>allowed to use the library.  A more frequent case is that a free</div><div class='line' id='LC126'>library does the same job as widely used non-free libraries.  In this</div><div class='line' id='LC127'>case, there is little to gain by limiting the free library to free</div><div class='line' id='LC128'>software only, so we use the Lesser General Public License.</div><div class='line' id='LC129'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC130'>&nbsp;&nbsp;In other cases, permission to use a particular library in non-free</div><div class='line' id='LC131'>programs enables a greater number of people to use a large body of</div><div class='line' id='LC132'>free software.  For example, permission to use the GNU C Library in</div><div class='line' id='LC133'>non-free programs enables many more people to use the whole GNU</div><div class='line' id='LC134'>operating system, as well as its variant, the GNU/Linux operating</div><div class='line' id='LC135'>system.</div><div class='line' id='LC136'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC137'>&nbsp;&nbsp;Although the Lesser General Public License is Less protective of the</div><div class='line' id='LC138'>users&#39; freedom, it does ensure that the user of a program that is</div><div class='line' id='LC139'>linked with the Library has the freedom and the wherewithal to run</div><div class='line' id='LC140'>that program using a modified version of the Library.</div><div class='line' id='LC141'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC142'>&nbsp;&nbsp;The precise terms and conditions for copying, distribution and</div><div class='line' id='LC143'>modification follow.  Pay close attention to the difference between a</div><div class='line' id='LC144'>&quot;work based on the library&quot; and a &quot;work that uses the library&quot;.  The</div><div class='line' id='LC145'>former contains code derived from the library, whereas the latter must</div><div class='line' id='LC146'>be combined with the library in order to run.</div><div class='line' id='LC147'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC148'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;GNU LESSER GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE</div><div class='line' id='LC149'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;TERMS AND CONDITIONS FOR COPYING, DISTRIBUTION AND MODIFICATION</div><div class='line' id='LC150'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC151'>&nbsp;&nbsp;0. This License Agreement applies to any software library or other</div><div class='line' id='LC152'>program which contains a notice placed by the copyright holder or</div><div class='line' id='LC153'>other authorized party saying it may be distributed under the terms of</div><div class='line' id='LC154'>this Lesser General Public License (also called &quot;this License&quot;).</div><div class='line' id='LC155'>Each licensee is addressed as &quot;you&quot;.</div><div class='line' id='LC156'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC157'>&nbsp;&nbsp;A &quot;library&quot; means a collection of software functions and/or data</div><div class='line' id='LC158'>prepared so as to be conveniently linked with application programs</div><div class='line' id='LC159'>(which use some of those functions and data) to form executables.</div><div class='line' id='LC160'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC161'>&nbsp;&nbsp;The &quot;Library&quot;, below, refers to any such software library or work</div><div class='line' id='LC162'>which has been distributed under these terms.  A &quot;work based on the</div><div class='line' id='LC163'>Library&quot; means either the Library or any derivative work under</div><div class='line' id='LC164'>copyright law: that is to say, a work containing the Library or a</div><div class='line' id='LC165'>portion of it, either verbatim or with modifications and/or translated</div><div class='line' id='LC166'>straightforwardly into another language.  (Hereinafter, translation is</div><div class='line' id='LC167'>included without limitation in the term &quot;modification&quot;.)</div><div class='line' id='LC168'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC169'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;Source code&quot; for a work means the preferred form of the work for</div><div class='line' id='LC170'>making modifications to it.  For a library, complete source code means</div><div class='line' id='LC171'>all the source code for all modules it contains, plus any associated</div><div class='line' id='LC172'>interface definition files, plus the scripts used to control compilation</div><div class='line' id='LC173'>and installation of the library.</div><div class='line' id='LC174'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC175'>&nbsp;&nbsp;Activities other than copying, distribution and modification are not</div><div class='line' id='LC176'>covered by this License; they are outside its scope.  The act of</div><div class='line' id='LC177'>running a program using the Library is not restricted, and output from</div><div class='line' id='LC178'>such a program is covered only if its contents constitute a work based</div><div class='line' id='LC179'>on the Library (independent of the use of the Library in a tool for</div><div class='line' id='LC180'>writing it).  Whether that is true depends on what the Library does</div><div class='line' id='LC181'>and what the program that uses the Library does.</div><div class='line' id='LC182'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC183'>&nbsp;&nbsp;1. You may copy and distribute verbatim copies of the Library&#39;s</div><div class='line' id='LC184'>complete source code as you receive it, in any medium, provided that</div><div class='line' id='LC185'>you conspicuously and appropriately publish on each copy an</div><div class='line' id='LC186'>appropriate copyright notice and disclaimer of warranty; keep intact</div><div class='line' id='LC187'>all the notices that refer to this License and to the absence of any</div><div class='line' id='LC188'>warranty; and distribute a copy of this License along with the</div><div class='line' id='LC189'>Library.</div><div class='line' id='LC190'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC191'>&nbsp;&nbsp;You may charge a fee for the physical act of transferring a copy,</div><div class='line' id='LC192'>and you may at your option offer warranty protection in exchange for a</div><div class='line' id='LC193'>fee.</div><div class='line' id='LC194'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC195'>&nbsp;&nbsp;2. You may modify your copy or copies of the Library or any portion</div><div class='line' id='LC196'>of it, thus forming a work based on the Library, and copy and</div><div class='line' id='LC197'>distribute such modifications or work under the terms of Section 1</div><div class='line' id='LC198'>above, provided that you also meet all of these conditions:</div><div class='line' id='LC199'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC200'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a) The modified work must itself be a software library.</div><div class='line' id='LC201'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC202'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b) You must cause the files modified to carry prominent notices</div><div class='line' id='LC203'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;stating that you changed the files and the date of any change.</div><div class='line' id='LC204'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC205'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;c) You must cause the whole of the work to be licensed at no</div><div class='line' id='LC206'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;charge to all third parties under the terms of this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC207'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC208'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;d) If a facility in the modified Library refers to a function or a</div><div class='line' id='LC209'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;table of data to be supplied by an application program that uses</div><div class='line' id='LC210'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the facility, other than as an argument passed when the facility</div><div class='line' id='LC211'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;is invoked, then you must make a good faith effort to ensure that,</div><div class='line' id='LC212'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in the event an application does not supply such function or</div><div class='line' id='LC213'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;table, the facility still operates, and performs whatever part of</div><div class='line' id='LC214'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;its purpose remains meaningful.</div><div class='line' id='LC215'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC216'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(For example, a function in a library to compute square roots has</div><div class='line' id='LC217'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a purpose that is entirely well-defined independent of the</div><div class='line' id='LC218'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;application.  Therefore, Subsection 2d requires that any</div><div class='line' id='LC219'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;application-supplied function or table used by this function must</div><div class='line' id='LC220'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;be optional: if the application does not supply it, the square</div><div class='line' id='LC221'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;root function must still compute square roots.)</div><div class='line' id='LC222'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC223'>These requirements apply to the modified work as a whole.  If</div><div class='line' id='LC224'>identifiable sections of that work are not derived from the Library,</div><div class='line' id='LC225'>and can be reasonably considered independent and separate works in</div><div class='line' id='LC226'>themselves, then this License, and its terms, do not apply to those</div><div class='line' id='LC227'>sections when you distribute them as separate works.  But when you</div><div class='line' id='LC228'>distribute the same sections as part of a whole which is a work based</div><div class='line' id='LC229'>on the Library, the distribution of the whole must be on the terms of</div><div class='line' id='LC230'>this License, whose permissions for other licensees extend to the</div><div class='line' id='LC231'>entire whole, and thus to each and every part regardless of who wrote</div><div class='line' id='LC232'>it.</div><div class='line' id='LC233'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC234'>Thus, it is not the intent of this section to claim rights or contest</div><div class='line' id='LC235'>your rights to work written entirely by you; rather, the intent is to</div><div class='line' id='LC236'>exercise the right to control the distribution of derivative or</div><div class='line' id='LC237'>collective works based on the Library.</div><div class='line' id='LC238'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC239'>In addition, mere aggregation of another work not based on the Library</div><div class='line' id='LC240'>with the Library (or with a work based on the Library) on a volume of</div><div class='line' id='LC241'>a storage or distribution medium does not bring the other work under</div><div class='line' id='LC242'>the scope of this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC243'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC244'>&nbsp;&nbsp;3. You may opt to apply the terms of the ordinary GNU General Public</div><div class='line' id='LC245'>License instead of this License to a given copy of the Library.  To do</div><div class='line' id='LC246'>this, you must alter all the notices that refer to this License, so</div><div class='line' id='LC247'>that they refer to the ordinary GNU General Public License, version 2,</div><div class='line' id='LC248'>instead of to this License.  (If a newer version than version 2 of the</div><div class='line' id='LC249'>ordinary GNU General Public License has appeared, then you can specify</div><div class='line' id='LC250'>that version instead if you wish.)  Do not make any other change in</div><div class='line' id='LC251'>these notices.</div><div class='line' id='LC252'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC253'>&nbsp;&nbsp;Once this change is made in a given copy, it is irreversible for</div><div class='line' id='LC254'>that copy, so the ordinary GNU General Public License applies to all</div><div class='line' id='LC255'>subsequent copies and derivative works made from that copy.</div><div class='line' id='LC256'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC257'>&nbsp;&nbsp;This option is useful when you wish to copy part of the code of</div><div class='line' id='LC258'>the Library into a program that is not a library.</div><div class='line' id='LC259'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC260'>&nbsp;&nbsp;4. You may copy and distribute the Library (or a portion or</div><div class='line' id='LC261'>derivative of it, under Section 2) in object code or executable form</div><div class='line' id='LC262'>under the terms of Sections 1 and 2 above provided that you accompany</div><div class='line' id='LC263'>it with the complete corresponding machine-readable source code, which</div><div class='line' id='LC264'>must be distributed under the terms of Sections 1 and 2 above on a</div><div class='line' id='LC265'>medium customarily used for software interchange.</div><div class='line' id='LC266'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC267'>&nbsp;&nbsp;If distribution of object code is made by offering access to copy</div><div class='line' id='LC268'>from a designated place, then offering equivalent access to copy the</div><div class='line' id='LC269'>source code from the same place satisfies the requirement to</div><div class='line' id='LC270'>distribute the source code, even though third parties are not</div><div class='line' id='LC271'>compelled to copy the source along with the object code.</div><div class='line' id='LC272'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC273'>&nbsp;&nbsp;5. A program that contains no derivative of any portion of the</div><div class='line' id='LC274'>Library, but is designed to work with the Library by being compiled or</div><div class='line' id='LC275'>linked with it, is called a &quot;work that uses the Library&quot;.  Such a</div><div class='line' id='LC276'>work, in isolation, is not a derivative work of the Library, and</div><div class='line' id='LC277'>therefore falls outside the scope of this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC278'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC279'>&nbsp;&nbsp;However, linking a &quot;work that uses the Library&quot; with the Library</div><div class='line' id='LC280'>creates an executable that is a derivative of the Library (because it</div><div class='line' id='LC281'>contains portions of the Library), rather than a &quot;work that uses the</div><div class='line' id='LC282'>library&quot;.  The executable is therefore covered by this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC283'>Section 6 states terms for distribution of such executables.</div><div class='line' id='LC284'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC285'>&nbsp;&nbsp;When a &quot;work that uses the Library&quot; uses material from a header file</div><div class='line' id='LC286'>that is part of the Library, the object code for the work may be a</div><div class='line' id='LC287'>derivative work of the Library even though the source code is not.</div><div class='line' id='LC288'>Whether this is true is especially significant if the work can be</div><div class='line' id='LC289'>linked without the Library, or if the work is itself a library.  The</div><div class='line' id='LC290'>threshold for this to be true is not precisely defined by law.</div><div class='line' id='LC291'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC292'>&nbsp;&nbsp;If such an object file uses only numerical parameters, data</div><div class='line' id='LC293'>structure layouts and accessors, and small macros and small inline</div><div class='line' id='LC294'>functions (ten lines or less in length), then the use of the object</div><div class='line' id='LC295'>file is unrestricted, regardless of whether it is legally a derivative</div><div class='line' id='LC296'>work.  (Executables containing this object code plus portions of the</div><div class='line' id='LC297'>Library will still fall under Section 6.)</div><div class='line' id='LC298'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC299'>&nbsp;&nbsp;Otherwise, if the work is a derivative of the Library, you may</div><div class='line' id='LC300'>distribute the object code for the work under the terms of Section 6.</div><div class='line' id='LC301'>Any executables containing that work also fall under Section 6,</div><div class='line' id='LC302'>whether or not they are linked directly with the Library itself.</div><div class='line' id='LC303'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC304'>&nbsp;&nbsp;6. As an exception to the Sections above, you may also combine or</div><div class='line' id='LC305'>link a &quot;work that uses the Library&quot; with the Library to produce a</div><div class='line' id='LC306'>work containing portions of the Library, and distribute that work</div><div class='line' id='LC307'>under terms of your choice, provided that the terms permit</div><div class='line' id='LC308'>modification of the work for the customer&#39;s own use and reverse</div><div class='line' id='LC309'>engineering for debugging such modifications.</div><div class='line' id='LC310'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC311'>&nbsp;&nbsp;You must give prominent notice with each copy of the work that the</div><div class='line' id='LC312'>Library is used in it and that the Library and its use are covered by</div><div class='line' id='LC313'>this License.  You must supply a copy of this License.  If the work</div><div class='line' id='LC314'>during execution displays copyright notices, you must include the</div><div class='line' id='LC315'>copyright notice for the Library among them, as well as a reference</div><div class='line' id='LC316'>directing the user to the copy of this License.  Also, you must do one</div><div class='line' id='LC317'>of these things:</div><div class='line' id='LC318'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC319'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a) Accompany the work with the complete corresponding</div><div class='line' id='LC320'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;machine-readable source code for the Library including whatever</div><div class='line' id='LC321'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;changes were used in the work (which must be distributed under</div><div class='line' id='LC322'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sections 1 and 2 above); and, if the work is an executable linked</div><div class='line' id='LC323'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;with the Library, with the complete machine-readable &quot;work that</div><div class='line' id='LC324'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;uses the Library&quot;, as object code and/or source code, so that the</div><div class='line' id='LC325'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;user can modify the Library and then relink to produce a modified</div><div class='line' id='LC326'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;executable containing the modified Library.  (It is understood</div><div class='line' id='LC327'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that the user who changes the contents of definitions files in the</div><div class='line' id='LC328'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Library will not necessarily be able to recompile the application</div><div class='line' id='LC329'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to use the modified definitions.)</div><div class='line' id='LC330'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC331'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b) Use a suitable shared library mechanism for linking with the</div><div class='line' id='LC332'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Library.  A suitable mechanism is one that (1) uses at run time a</div><div class='line' id='LC333'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;copy of the library already present on the user&#39;s computer system,</div><div class='line' id='LC334'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;rather than copying library functions into the executable, and (2)</div><div class='line' id='LC335'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;will operate properly with a modified version of the library, if</div><div class='line' id='LC336'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the user installs one, as long as the modified version is</div><div class='line' id='LC337'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;interface-compatible with the version that the work was made with.</div><div class='line' id='LC338'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC339'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;c) Accompany the work with a written offer, valid for at</div><div class='line' id='LC340'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;least three years, to give the same user the materials</div><div class='line' id='LC341'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;specified in Subsection 6a, above, for a charge no more</div><div class='line' id='LC342'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;than the cost of performing this distribution.</div><div class='line' id='LC343'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC344'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;d) If distribution of the work is made by offering access to copy</div><div class='line' id='LC345'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;from a designated place, offer equivalent access to copy the above</div><div class='line' id='LC346'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;specified materials from the same place.</div><div class='line' id='LC347'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC348'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;e) Verify that the user has already received a copy of these</div><div class='line' id='LC349'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;materials or that you have already sent this user a copy.</div><div class='line' id='LC350'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC351'>&nbsp;&nbsp;For an executable, the required form of the &quot;work that uses the</div><div class='line' id='LC352'>Library&quot; must include any data and utility programs needed for</div><div class='line' id='LC353'>reproducing the executable from it.  However, as a special exception,</div><div class='line' id='LC354'>the materials to be distributed need not include anything that is</div><div class='line' id='LC355'>normally distributed (in either source or binary form) with the major</div><div class='line' id='LC356'>components (compiler, kernel, and so on) of the operating system on</div><div class='line' id='LC357'>which the executable runs, unless that component itself accompanies</div><div class='line' id='LC358'>the executable.</div><div class='line' id='LC359'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC360'>&nbsp;&nbsp;It may happen that this requirement contradicts the license</div><div class='line' id='LC361'>restrictions of other proprietary libraries that do not normally</div><div class='line' id='LC362'>accompany the operating system.  Such a contradiction means you cannot</div><div class='line' id='LC363'>use both them and the Library together in an executable that you</div><div class='line' id='LC364'>distribute.</div><div class='line' id='LC365'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC366'>&nbsp;&nbsp;7. You may place library facilities that are a work based on the</div><div class='line' id='LC367'>Library side-by-side in a single library together with other library</div><div class='line' id='LC368'>facilities not covered by this License, and distribute such a combined</div><div class='line' id='LC369'>library, provided that the separate distribution of the work based on</div><div class='line' id='LC370'>the Library and of the other library facilities is otherwise</div><div class='line' id='LC371'>permitted, and provided that you do these two things:</div><div class='line' id='LC372'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC373'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a) Accompany the combined library with a copy of the same work</div><div class='line' id='LC374'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;based on the Library, uncombined with any other library</div><div class='line' id='LC375'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;facilities.  This must be distributed under the terms of the</div><div class='line' id='LC376'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sections above.</div><div class='line' id='LC377'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC378'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b) Give prominent notice with the combined library of the fact</div><div class='line' id='LC379'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that part of it is a work based on the Library, and explaining</div><div class='line' id='LC380'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;where to find the accompanying uncombined form of the same work.</div><div class='line' id='LC381'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC382'>&nbsp;&nbsp;8. You may not copy, modify, sublicense, link with, or distribute</div><div class='line' id='LC383'>the Library except as expressly provided under this License.  Any</div><div class='line' id='LC384'>attempt otherwise to copy, modify, sublicense, link with, or</div><div class='line' id='LC385'>distribute the Library is void, and will automatically terminate your</div><div class='line' id='LC386'>rights under this License.  However, parties who have received copies,</div><div class='line' id='LC387'>or rights, from you under this License will not have their licenses</div><div class='line' id='LC388'>terminated so long as such parties remain in full compliance.</div><div class='line' id='LC389'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC390'>&nbsp;&nbsp;9. You are not required to accept this License, since you have not</div><div class='line' id='LC391'>signed it.  However, nothing else grants you permission to modify or</div><div class='line' id='LC392'>distribute the Library or its derivative works.  These actions are</div><div class='line' id='LC393'>prohibited by law if you do not accept this License.  Therefore, by</div><div class='line' id='LC394'>modifying or distributing the Library (or any work based on the</div><div class='line' id='LC395'>Library), you indicate your acceptance of this License to do so, and</div><div class='line' id='LC396'>all its terms and conditions for copying, distributing or modifying</div><div class='line' id='LC397'>the Library or works based on it.</div><div class='line' id='LC398'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC399'>&nbsp;&nbsp;10. Each time you redistribute the Library (or any work based on the</div><div class='line' id='LC400'>Library), the recipient automatically receives a license from the</div><div class='line' id='LC401'>original licensor to copy, distribute, link with or modify the Library</div><div class='line' id='LC402'>subject to these terms and conditions.  You may not impose any further</div><div class='line' id='LC403'>restrictions on the recipients&#39; exercise of the rights granted herein.</div><div class='line' id='LC404'>You are not responsible for enforcing compliance by third parties with</div><div class='line' id='LC405'>this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC406'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC407'>&nbsp;&nbsp;11. If, as a consequence of a court judgment or allegation of patent</div><div class='line' id='LC408'>infringement or for any other reason (not limited to patent issues),</div><div class='line' id='LC409'>conditions are imposed on you (whether by court order, agreement or</div><div class='line' id='LC410'>otherwise) that contradict the conditions of this License, they do not</div><div class='line' id='LC411'>excuse you from the conditions of this License.  If you cannot</div><div class='line' id='LC412'>distribute so as to satisfy simultaneously your obligations under this</div><div class='line' id='LC413'>License and any other pertinent obligations, then as a consequence you</div><div class='line' id='LC414'>may not distribute the Library at all.  For example, if a patent</div><div class='line' id='LC415'>license would not permit royalty-free redistribution of the Library by</div><div class='line' id='LC416'>all those who receive copies directly or indirectly through you, then</div><div class='line' id='LC417'>the only way you could satisfy both it and this License would be to</div><div class='line' id='LC418'>refrain entirely from distribution of the Library.</div><div class='line' id='LC419'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC420'>If any portion of this section is held invalid or unenforceable under any</div><div class='line' id='LC421'>particular circumstance, the balance of the section is intended to apply,</div><div class='line' id='LC422'>and the section as a whole is intended to apply in other circumstances.</div><div class='line' id='LC423'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC424'>It is not the purpose of this section to induce you to infringe any</div><div class='line' id='LC425'>patents or other property right claims or to contest validity of any</div><div class='line' id='LC426'>such claims; this section has the sole purpose of protecting the</div><div class='line' id='LC427'>integrity of the free software distribution system which is</div><div class='line' id='LC428'>implemented by public license practices.  Many people have made</div><div class='line' id='LC429'>generous contributions to the wide range of software distributed</div><div class='line' id='LC430'>through that system in reliance on consistent application of that</div><div class='line' id='LC431'>system; it is up to the author/donor to decide if he or she is willing</div><div class='line' id='LC432'>to distribute software through any other system and a licensee cannot</div><div class='line' id='LC433'>impose that choice.</div><div class='line' id='LC434'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC435'>This section is intended to make thoroughly clear what is believed to</div><div class='line' id='LC436'>be a consequence of the rest of this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC437'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC438'>&nbsp;&nbsp;12. If the distribution and/or use of the Library is restricted in</div><div class='line' id='LC439'>certain countries either by patents or by copyrighted interfaces, the</div><div class='line' id='LC440'>original copyright holder who places the Library under this License may add</div><div class='line' id='LC441'>an explicit geographical distribution limitation excluding those countries,</div><div class='line' id='LC442'>so that distribution is permitted only in or among countries not thus</div><div class='line' id='LC443'>excluded.  In such case, this License incorporates the limitation as if</div><div class='line' id='LC444'>written in the body of this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC445'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC446'>&nbsp;&nbsp;13. The Free Software Foundation may publish revised and/or new</div><div class='line' id='LC447'>versions of the Lesser General Public License from time to time.</div><div class='line' id='LC448'>Such new versions will be similar in spirit to the present version,</div><div class='line' id='LC449'>but may differ in detail to address new problems or concerns.</div><div class='line' id='LC450'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC451'>Each version is given a distinguishing version number.  If the Library</div><div class='line' id='LC452'>specifies a version number of this License which applies to it and</div><div class='line' id='LC453'>&quot;any later version&quot;, you have the option of following the terms and</div><div class='line' id='LC454'>conditions either of that version or of any later version published by</div><div class='line' id='LC455'>the Free Software Foundation.  If the Library does not specify a</div><div class='line' id='LC456'>license version number, you may choose any version ever published by</div><div class='line' id='LC457'>the Free Software Foundation.</div><div class='line' id='LC458'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC459'>&nbsp;&nbsp;14. If you wish to incorporate parts of the Library into other free</div><div class='line' id='LC460'>programs whose distribution conditions are incompatible with these,</div><div class='line' id='LC461'>write to the author to ask for permission.  For software which is</div><div class='line' id='LC462'>copyrighted by the Free Software Foundation, write to the Free</div><div class='line' id='LC463'>Software Foundation; we sometimes make exceptions for this.  Our</div><div class='line' id='LC464'>decision will be guided by the two goals of preserving the free status</div><div class='line' id='LC465'>of all derivatives of our free software and of promoting the sharing</div><div class='line' id='LC466'>and reuse of software generally.</div><div class='line' id='LC467'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC468'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NO WARRANTY</div><div class='line' id='LC469'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC470'>&nbsp;&nbsp;15. BECAUSE THE LIBRARY IS LICENSED FREE OF CHARGE, THERE IS NO</div><div class='line' id='LC471'>WARRANTY FOR THE LIBRARY, TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW.</div><div class='line' id='LC472'>EXCEPT WHEN OTHERWISE STATED IN WRITING THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND/OR</div><div class='line' id='LC473'>OTHER PARTIES PROVIDE THE LIBRARY &quot;AS IS&quot; WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY</div><div class='line' id='LC474'>KIND, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE</div><div class='line' id='LC475'>IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR</div><div class='line' id='LC476'>PURPOSE.  THE ENTIRE RISK AS TO THE QUALITY AND PERFORMANCE OF THE</div><div class='line' id='LC477'>LIBRARY IS WITH YOU.  SHOULD THE LIBRARY PROVE DEFECTIVE, YOU ASSUME</div><div class='line' id='LC478'>THE COST OF ALL NECESSARY SERVICING, REPAIR OR CORRECTION.</div><div class='line' id='LC479'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC480'>&nbsp;&nbsp;16. IN NO EVENT UNLESS REQUIRED BY APPLICABLE LAW OR AGREED TO IN</div><div class='line' id='LC481'>WRITING WILL ANY COPYRIGHT HOLDER, OR ANY OTHER PARTY WHO MAY MODIFY</div><div class='line' id='LC482'>AND/OR REDISTRIBUTE THE LIBRARY AS PERMITTED ABOVE, BE LIABLE TO YOU</div><div class='line' id='LC483'>FOR DAMAGES, INCLUDING ANY GENERAL, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL OR</div><div class='line' id='LC484'>CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THE USE OR INABILITY TO USE THE</div><div class='line' id='LC485'>LIBRARY (INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO LOSS OF DATA OR DATA BEING</div><div class='line' id='LC486'>RENDERED INACCURATE OR LOSSES SUSTAINED BY YOU OR THIRD PARTIES OR A</div><div class='line' id='LC487'>FAILURE OF THE LIBRARY TO OPERATE WITH ANY OTHER SOFTWARE), EVEN IF</div><div class='line' id='LC488'>SUCH HOLDER OR OTHER PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH</div><div class='line' id='LC489'>DAMAGES.</div><div class='line' id='LC490'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC491'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;END OF TERMS AND CONDITIONS</div><div class='line' id='LC492'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC493'>---------------------------------------------------------------------</div><div class='line' id='LC494'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC495'>COMMON DEVELOPMENT AND DISTRIBUTION LICENSE Version 1.0</div><div class='line' id='LC496'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC497'>1. Definitions.</div><div class='line' id='LC498'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC499'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.1. &quot;Contributor&quot; means each individual or entity that creates</div><div class='line' id='LC500'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;or contributes to the creation of Modifications.</div><div class='line' id='LC501'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC502'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2. &quot;Contributor Version&quot; means the combination of the Original</div><div class='line' id='LC503'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Software, prior Modifications used by a Contributor (if any),</div><div class='line' id='LC504'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and the Modifications made by that particular Contributor.</div><div class='line' id='LC505'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC506'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.3. &quot;Covered Software&quot; means (a) the Original Software, or (b)</div><div class='line' id='LC507'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Modifications, or (c) the combination of files containing</div><div class='line' id='LC508'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Original Software with files containing Modifications, in</div><div class='line' id='LC509'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;each case including portions thereof.</div><div class='line' id='LC510'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC511'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.4. &quot;Executable&quot; means the Covered Software in any form other</div><div class='line' id='LC512'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;than Source Code.</div><div class='line' id='LC513'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC514'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.5. &quot;Initial Developer&quot; means the individual or entity that first</div><div class='line' id='LC515'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;makes Original Software available under this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC516'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC517'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.6. &quot;Larger Work&quot; means a work which combines Covered Software or</div><div class='line' id='LC518'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;portions thereof with code not governed by the terms of this</div><div class='line' id='LC519'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;License.</div><div class='line' id='LC520'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC521'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.7. &quot;License&quot; means this document.</div><div class='line' id='LC522'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC523'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.8. &quot;Licensable&quot; means having the right to grant, to the maximum</div><div class='line' id='LC524'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;extent possible, whether at the time of the initial grant or</div><div class='line' id='LC525'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;subsequently acquired, any and all of the rights conveyed</div><div class='line' id='LC526'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;herein.</div><div class='line' id='LC527'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC528'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.9. &quot;Modifications&quot; means the Source Code and Executable form of</div><div class='line' id='LC529'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;any of the following:</div><div class='line' id='LC530'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC531'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A. Any file that results from an addition to, deletion from or</div><div class='line' id='LC532'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;modification of the contents of a file containing Original</div><div class='line' id='LC533'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Software or previous Modifications;</div><div class='line' id='LC534'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC535'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B. Any new file that contains any part of the Original</div><div class='line' id='LC536'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Software or previous Modifications; or</div><div class='line' id='LC537'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC538'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C. Any new file that is contributed or otherwise made</div><div class='line' id='LC539'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;available under the terms of this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC540'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC541'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.10. &quot;Original Software&quot; means the Source Code and Executable</div><div class='line' id='LC542'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;form of computer software code that is originally released</div><div class='line' id='LC543'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;under this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC544'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC545'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.11. &quot;Patent Claims&quot; means any patent claim(s), now owned or</div><div class='line' id='LC546'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hereafter acquired, including without limitation, method,</div><div class='line' id='LC547'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;process, and apparatus claims, in any patent Licensable by</div><div class='line' id='LC548'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;grantor.</div><div class='line' id='LC549'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC550'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.12. &quot;Source Code&quot; means (a) the common form of computer software</div><div class='line' id='LC551'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;code in which modifications are made and (b) associated</div><div class='line' id='LC552'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;documentation included in or with such code.</div><div class='line' id='LC553'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC554'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.13. &quot;You&quot; (or &quot;Your&quot;) means an individual or a legal entity</div><div class='line' id='LC555'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;exercising rights under, and complying with all of the terms</div><div class='line' id='LC556'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of, this License.  For legal entities, &quot;You&quot; includes any</div><div class='line' id='LC557'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;entity which controls, is controlled by, or is under common</div><div class='line' id='LC558'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;control with You.  For purposes of this definition,</div><div class='line' id='LC559'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;control&quot; means (a) the power, direct or indirect, to cause</div><div class='line' id='LC560'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the direction or management of such entity, whether by</div><div class='line' id='LC561'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;contract or otherwise, or (b) ownership of more than fifty</div><div class='line' id='LC562'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;percent (50%) of the outstanding shares or beneficial</div><div class='line' id='LC563'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ownership of such entity.</div><div class='line' id='LC564'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC565'>2. License Grants.</div><div class='line' id='LC566'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC567'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1. The Initial Developer Grant.</div><div class='line' id='LC568'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC569'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conditioned upon Your compliance with Section 3.1 below and</div><div class='line' id='LC570'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;subject to third party intellectual property claims, the Initial</div><div class='line' id='LC571'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Developer hereby grants You a world-wide, royalty-free,</div><div class='line' id='LC572'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;non-exclusive license:</div><div class='line' id='LC573'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC574'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) under intellectual property rights (other than patent or</div><div class='line' id='LC575'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;trademark) Licensable by Initial Developer, to use,</div><div class='line' id='LC576'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;reproduce, modify, display, perform, sublicense and</div><div class='line' id='LC577'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;distribute the Original Software (or portions thereof),</div><div class='line' id='LC578'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;with or without Modifications, and/or as part of a Larger</div><div class='line' id='LC579'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Work; and</div><div class='line' id='LC580'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC581'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) under Patent Claims infringed by the making, using or</div><div class='line' id='LC582'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;selling of Original Software, to make, have made, use,</div><div class='line' id='LC583'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;practice, sell, and offer for sale, and/or otherwise</div><div class='line' id='LC584'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;dispose of the Original Software (or portions thereof).</div><div class='line' id='LC585'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC586'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c) The licenses granted in Sections 2.1(a) and (b) are</div><div class='line' id='LC587'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;effective on the date Initial Developer first distributes</div><div class='line' id='LC588'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;or otherwise makes the Original Software available to a</div><div class='line' id='LC589'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;third party under the terms of this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC590'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC591'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d) Notwithstanding Section 2.1(b) above, no patent license is</div><div class='line' id='LC592'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;granted: (1) for code that You delete from the Original</div><div class='line' id='LC593'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Software, or (2) for infringements caused by: (i) the</div><div class='line' id='LC594'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;modification of the Original Software, or (ii) the</div><div class='line' id='LC595'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;combination of the Original Software with other software</div><div class='line' id='LC596'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;or devices.</div><div class='line' id='LC597'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC598'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2. Contributor Grant.</div><div class='line' id='LC599'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC600'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conditioned upon Your compliance with Section 3.1 below and</div><div class='line' id='LC601'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;subject to third party intellectual property claims, each</div><div class='line' id='LC602'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contributor hereby grants You a world-wide, royalty-free,</div><div class='line' id='LC603'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;non-exclusive license:</div><div class='line' id='LC604'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC605'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) under intellectual property rights (other than patent or</div><div class='line' id='LC606'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;trademark) Licensable by Contributor to use, reproduce,</div><div class='line' id='LC607'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;modify, display, perform, sublicense and distribute the</div><div class='line' id='LC608'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Modifications created by such Contributor (or portions</div><div class='line' id='LC609'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;thereof), either on an unmodified basis, with other</div><div class='line' id='LC610'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Modifications, as Covered Software and/or as part of a</div><div class='line' id='LC611'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Larger Work; and</div><div class='line' id='LC612'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC613'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) under Patent Claims infringed by the making, using, or</div><div class='line' id='LC614'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;selling of Modifications made by that Contributor either</div><div class='line' id='LC615'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;alone and/or in combination with its Contributor Version</div><div class='line' id='LC616'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(or portions of such combination), to make, use, sell,</div><div class='line' id='LC617'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;offer for sale, have made, and/or otherwise dispose of:</div><div class='line' id='LC618'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1) Modifications made by that Contributor (or portions</div><div class='line' id='LC619'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;thereof); and (2) the combination of Modifications made by</div><div class='line' id='LC620'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that Contributor with its Contributor Version (or portions</div><div class='line' id='LC621'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of such combination).</div><div class='line' id='LC622'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC623'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c) The licenses granted in Sections 2.2(a) and 2.2(b) are</div><div class='line' id='LC624'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;effective on the date Contributor first distributes or</div><div class='line' id='LC625'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;otherwise makes the Modifications available to a third</div><div class='line' id='LC626'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;party.</div><div class='line' id='LC627'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC628'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d) Notwithstanding Section 2.2(b) above, no patent license is</div><div class='line' id='LC629'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;granted: (1) for any code that Contributor has deleted</div><div class='line' id='LC630'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;from the Contributor Version; (2) for infringements caused</div><div class='line' id='LC631'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;by: (i) third party modifications of Contributor Version,</div><div class='line' id='LC632'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;or (ii) the combination of Modifications made by that</div><div class='line' id='LC633'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contributor with other software (except as part of the</div><div class='line' id='LC634'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contributor Version) or other devices; or (3) under Patent</div><div class='line' id='LC635'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Claims infringed by Covered Software in the absence of</div><div class='line' id='LC636'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Modifications made by that Contributor.</div><div class='line' id='LC637'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC638'>3. Distribution Obligations.</div><div class='line' id='LC639'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC640'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.1. Availability of Source Code.</div><div class='line' id='LC641'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC642'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any Covered Software that You distribute or otherwise make</div><div class='line' id='LC643'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;available in Executable form must also be made available in Source</div><div class='line' id='LC644'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Code form and that Source Code form must be distributed only under</div><div class='line' id='LC645'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the terms of this License.  You must include a copy of this</div><div class='line' id='LC646'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;License with every copy of the Source Code form of the Covered</div><div class='line' id='LC647'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Software You distribute or otherwise make available.  You must</div><div class='line' id='LC648'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;inform recipients of any such Covered Software in Executable form</div><div class='line' id='LC649'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;as to how they can obtain such Covered Software in Source Code</div><div class='line' id='LC650'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;form in a reasonable manner on or through a medium customarily</div><div class='line' id='LC651'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;used for software exchange.</div><div class='line' id='LC652'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC653'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2. Modifications.</div><div class='line' id='LC654'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC655'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Modifications that You create or to which You contribute are</div><div class='line' id='LC656'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;governed by the terms of this License.  You represent that You</div><div class='line' id='LC657'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;believe Your Modifications are Your original creation(s) and/or</div><div class='line' id='LC658'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You have sufficient rights to grant the rights conveyed by this</div><div class='line' id='LC659'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;License.</div><div class='line' id='LC660'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC661'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.3. Required Notices.</div><div class='line' id='LC662'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC663'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You must include a notice in each of Your Modifications that</div><div class='line' id='LC664'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;identifies You as the Contributor of the Modification.  You may</div><div class='line' id='LC665'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;not remove or alter any copyright, patent or trademark notices</div><div class='line' id='LC666'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;contained within the Covered Software, or any notices of licensing</div><div class='line' id='LC667'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;or any descriptive text giving attribution to any Contributor or</div><div class='line' id='LC668'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Initial Developer.</div><div class='line' id='LC669'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC670'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.4. Application of Additional Terms.</div><div class='line' id='LC671'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC672'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You may not offer or impose any terms on any Covered Software in</div><div class='line' id='LC673'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Source Code form that alters or restricts the applicable version</div><div class='line' id='LC674'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of this License or the recipients&#39; rights hereunder.  You may</div><div class='line' id='LC675'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;choose to offer, and to charge a fee for, warranty, support,</div><div class='line' id='LC676'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;indemnity or liability obligations to one or more recipients of</div><div class='line' id='LC677'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Covered Software.  However, you may do so only on Your own behalf,</div><div class='line' id='LC678'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and not on behalf of the Initial Developer or any Contributor.</div><div class='line' id='LC679'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You must make it absolutely clear that any such warranty, support,</div><div class='line' id='LC680'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;indemnity or liability obligation is offered by You alone, and You</div><div class='line' id='LC681'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;hereby agree to indemnify the Initial Developer and every</div><div class='line' id='LC682'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contributor for any liability incurred by the Initial Developer or</div><div class='line' id='LC683'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;such Contributor as a result of warranty, support, indemnity or</div><div class='line' id='LC684'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;liability terms You offer.</div><div class='line' id='LC685'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC686'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.5. Distribution of Executable Versions.</div><div class='line' id='LC687'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC688'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You may distribute the Executable form of the Covered Software</div><div class='line' id='LC689'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;under the terms of this License or under the terms of a license of</div><div class='line' id='LC690'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Your choice, which may contain terms different from this License,</div><div class='line' id='LC691'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;provided that You are in compliance with the terms of this License</div><div class='line' id='LC692'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and that the license for the Executable form does not attempt to</div><div class='line' id='LC693'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;limit or alter the recipient&#39;s rights in the Source Code form from</div><div class='line' id='LC694'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the rights set forth in this License.  If You distribute the</div><div class='line' id='LC695'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Covered Software in Executable form under a different license, You</div><div class='line' id='LC696'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;must make it absolutely clear that any terms which differ from</div><div class='line' id='LC697'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;this License are offered by You alone, not by the Initial</div><div class='line' id='LC698'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Developer or Contributor.  You hereby agree to indemnify the</div><div class='line' id='LC699'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Initial Developer and every Contributor for any liability incurred</div><div class='line' id='LC700'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;by the Initial Developer or such Contributor as a result of any</div><div class='line' id='LC701'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;such terms You offer.</div><div class='line' id='LC702'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC703'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.6. Larger Works.</div><div class='line' id='LC704'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC705'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You may create a Larger Work by combining Covered Software with</div><div class='line' id='LC706'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;other code not governed by the terms of this License and</div><div class='line' id='LC707'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;distribute the Larger Work as a single product.  In such a case,</div><div class='line' id='LC708'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You must make sure the requirements of this License are fulfilled</div><div class='line' id='LC709'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for the Covered Software.</div><div class='line' id='LC710'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC711'>4. Versions of the License.</div><div class='line' id='LC712'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC713'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1. New Versions.</div><div class='line' id='LC714'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC715'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sun Microsystems, Inc. is the initial license steward and may</div><div class='line' id='LC716'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;publish revised and/or new versions of this License from time to</div><div class='line' id='LC717'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;time.  Each version will be given a distinguishing version number.</div><div class='line' id='LC718'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as provided in Section 4.3, no one other than the license</div><div class='line' id='LC719'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;steward has the right to modify this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC720'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC721'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2. Effect of New Versions.</div><div class='line' id='LC722'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC723'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You may always continue to use, distribute or otherwise make the</div><div class='line' id='LC724'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Covered Software available under the terms of the version of the</div><div class='line' id='LC725'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;License under which You originally received the Covered Software.</div><div class='line' id='LC726'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Initial Developer includes a notice in the Original</div><div class='line' id='LC727'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Software prohibiting it from being distributed or otherwise made</div><div class='line' id='LC728'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;available under any subsequent version of the License, You must</div><div class='line' id='LC729'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;distribute and make the Covered Software available under the terms</div><div class='line' id='LC730'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of the version of the License under which You originally received</div><div class='line' id='LC731'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Covered Software.  Otherwise, You may also choose to use,</div><div class='line' id='LC732'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;distribute or otherwise make the Covered Software available under</div><div class='line' id='LC733'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the terms of any subsequent version of the License published by</div><div class='line' id='LC734'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the license steward.</div><div class='line' id='LC735'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC736'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.3. Modified Versions.</div><div class='line' id='LC737'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC738'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;When You are an Initial Developer and You want to create a new</div><div class='line' id='LC739'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;license for Your Original Software, You may create and use a</div><div class='line' id='LC740'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;modified version of this License if You: (a) rename the license</div><div class='line' id='LC741'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and remove any references to the name of the license steward</div><div class='line' id='LC742'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(except to note that the license differs from this License); and</div><div class='line' id='LC743'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) otherwise make it clear that the license contains terms which</div><div class='line' id='LC744'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;differ from this License.</div><div class='line' id='LC745'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC746'>5. DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTY.</div><div class='line' id='LC747'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC748'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;COVERED SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED UNDER THIS LICENSE ON AN &quot;AS IS&quot;</div><div class='line' id='LC749'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED,</div><div class='line' id='LC750'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, WARRANTIES THAT THE COVERED</div><div class='line' id='LC751'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SOFTWARE IS FREE OF DEFECTS, MERCHANTABLE, FIT FOR A PARTICULAR</div><div class='line' id='LC752'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;PURPOSE OR NON-INFRINGING.  THE ENTIRE RISK AS TO THE QUALITY AND</div><div class='line' id='LC753'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;PERFORMANCE OF THE COVERED SOFTWARE IS WITH YOU.  SHOULD ANY</div><div class='line' id='LC754'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;COVERED SOFTWARE PROVE DEFECTIVE IN ANY RESPECT, YOU (NOT THE</div><div class='line' id='LC755'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;INITIAL DEVELOPER OR ANY OTHER CONTRIBUTOR) ASSUME THE COST OF ANY</div><div class='line' id='LC756'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NECESSARY SERVICING, REPAIR OR CORRECTION.  THIS DISCLAIMER OF</div><div class='line' id='LC757'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WARRANTY CONSTITUTES AN ESSENTIAL PART OF THIS LICENSE.  NO USE OF</div><div class='line' id='LC758'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ANY COVERED SOFTWARE IS AUTHORIZED HEREUNDER EXCEPT UNDER THIS</div><div class='line' id='LC759'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DISCLAIMER.</div><div class='line' id='LC760'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC761'>6. TERMINATION.</div><div class='line' id='LC762'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC763'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.1. This License and the rights granted hereunder will terminate</div><div class='line' id='LC764'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;automatically if You fail to comply with terms herein and fail to</div><div class='line' id='LC765'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;cure such breach within 30 days of becoming aware of the breach.</div><div class='line' id='LC766'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Provisions which, by their nature, must remain in effect beyond</div><div class='line' id='LC767'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the termination of this License shall survive.</div><div class='line' id='LC768'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC769'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.2. If You assert a patent infringement claim (excluding</div><div class='line' id='LC770'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;declaratory judgment actions) against Initial Developer or a</div><div class='line' id='LC771'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contributor (the Initial Developer or Contributor against whom You</div><div class='line' id='LC772'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;assert such claim is referred to as &quot;Participant&quot;) alleging that</div><div class='line' id='LC773'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Participant Software (meaning the Contributor Version where</div><div class='line' id='LC774'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Participant is a Contributor or the Original Software where</div><div class='line' id='LC775'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Participant is the Initial Developer) directly or indirectly</div><div class='line' id='LC776'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;infringes any patent, then any and all rights granted directly or</div><div class='line' id='LC777'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;indirectly to You by such Participant, the Initial Developer (if</div><div class='line' id='LC778'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Initial Developer is not the Participant) and all Contributors</div><div class='line' id='LC779'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;under Sections 2.1 and/or 2.2 of this License shall, upon 60 days</div><div class='line' id='LC780'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;notice from Participant terminate prospectively and automatically</div><div class='line' id='LC781'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;at the expiration of such 60 day notice period, unless if within</div><div class='line' id='LC782'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;such 60 day period You withdraw Your claim with respect to the</div><div class='line' id='LC783'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Participant Software against such Participant either unilaterally</div><div class='line' id='LC784'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;or pursuant to a written agreement with Participant.</div><div class='line' id='LC785'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC786'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.3. In the event of termination under Sections 6.1 or 6.2 above,</div><div class='line' id='LC787'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all end user licenses that have been validly granted by You or any</div><div class='line' id='LC788'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;distributor hereunder prior to termination (excluding licenses</div><div class='line' id='LC789'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;granted to You by any distributor) shall survive termination.</div><div class='line' id='LC790'><br/></div><div class='line' id='LC791'>7.
